lenders.name: Caroline
lenders.loan_because: I want to share in the lives of others around the world who inspire me with their courage, perseverance and vision.

lenders.name: Carla
lenders.loan_because: I care about people trying to help themselves and their families.

lenders.name: Jeff
lenders.loan_because: I am a Christian, and I believe it is something Jesus Christ would do.

lenders.name: Heather

lenders.occupational_info: i help people follow and make health care laws & run a small business that helps teenagers

lenders.name: Meg
lenders.loan_because: I believe in the power of one individual\'s actions and imprint on the world. The internet is an amazing way to forge useful and sincere connections between disparate pursuits and resources, and to bring together like-minded people to help a common cause.
lenders.occupational_info: An all-female-owned Editorial Services corporation that provides writing, proofreading and other content services to a wide array of customers.

lenders.name: Elaine
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.name: Kevin
lenders.occupation: university student and sports store employee

lenders.name: Rob Guzman
lenders.loan_because: It is my duty to help my fellow man.

lenders.name: Anne
lenders.loan_because: I believe that individuals directly helping each other whenever possible is the best way to learn, grow and accomplish.
lenders.occupational_info: For forty-one years I taught English in high school.  For thirty of those years I taught non-English speaking students very new to the US and very eager to work hard and succeed.

lenders.name: Donna
lenders.loan_because: I can
lenders.occupational_info: helping to build the world's first online philanthropic marketplace

lenders.name: Ryan & Nicole

lenders.occupational_info: I represent poeple who have been hurt or taken advantage of and try to make them complete again

lenders.occupation: Evidence Action, Director of Business Development & Strategy
lenders.loan_because: I am able

lenders.name: Zenzele & Jahzara
lenders.loan_because: I am the change I wish to see in the world...

lenders.name: Kennesaw State Enactus (Formerly SIFE)
lenders.loan_because: We see this as one of the best ways of supporting the Millennium Development Goals.  One person at a time!
lenders.occupational_info: We are a University Enactus team (formerly SIFE) and our mission is to teach and support free enterprise throughout the world.

lenders.name: Jason
lenders.loan_because: I can.
lenders.occupational_info: student

lenders.name: Sean
lenders.loan_because: I believe entrepreneurship is the way forward. We got our own startup off the ground via angel investors.  I'm certainly not rich but given how far so little can go it seems only right to be an angel investor for someone else trying to start a business.
lenders.occupational_info: Imagine difficult activities that take you two days to complete- for instance retrieving water from a far away well. What if that task could be magically reduced to under a minute!  We do that for people with complicated computer programs.

lenders.name: Carmen
lenders.loan_because: I am fortunate to be able to. It gives me joy.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a company that helps people send money home to their families, using the Internet.

lenders.name: Mark
lenders.loan_because: Those who ask should receive.
lenders.occupational_info: My work involves keeping people save in what can be very dangerous places.  My horses, and partner are my cornerstone.  We believe in giving because it feels right to do so.  Kiva allows us to do it over and over...

lenders.name: jeff
lenders.loan_because: The world Can be better without Government intervention
lenders.occupational_info: I work so the Government can waste my money

lenders.name: Kyle
lenders.loan_because: I like to help when I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a photography student at the San Francisco Art Institute. I love taking photos of people and connecting with new individuals.

lenders.name: Katherine and Luke
lenders.loan_because: We feel like everybody deserves a chance to build something for themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: We read books and screenplays and try to find stories that would make good movies.

lenders.name: Jackson
lenders.loan_because: My uncles gave me a Kiva gift certificate for my first Christmas. You can never be too young to help others.

lenders.name: Christina
lenders.loan_because: I have my own business and know that it takes a lot to get started. I also want to give back to others as many people gave me opportunity when I was getting started
lenders.occupational_info: I am director of an agency that provides therapy to children and adults with developmental disabilities

lenders.name: brian
lenders.loan_because: i believe in people to create their own success.

lenders.name: Ian
lenders.loan_because: I want to do my part!

lenders.name: Peter Harborow
lenders.loan_because: i want to help make people successful
lenders.occupational_info: Software sales professional, selling computer software

lenders.name: Yamini
lenders.loan_because: I can

lenders.name: Benoit
lenders.loan_because: Because I can
lenders.occupational_info: I\'m an engineer working on internet related technologies.

lenders.name: Hope
lenders.loan_because: I loan because I am blessed and I want to share those blessings with other members of my Human Family.  I am constantly in awe of the courage it takes to reach out beyond the lives we've been 'handed' to create BETTER lives for our selves and our families. These Kiva proprietors and business people have that courage and I am proud to be a small part of their journey.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a life coach and it is my passion to help people empower their lives.I also work in the theatre as a director  and teacher to educate, enlighten and entertain. I am a fourth generation theatre artist.

lenders.name: William
lenders.loan_because: I started my own business with borrowed money from someone who had faith in my abilities.  I believe that faith in others is the real currency that helps entrepreneurs succeed.

lenders.name: Nico
lenders.loan_because: I have a really nice life. I am grateful for all that I have. I want to share and make the world a better place.
lenders.occupational_info: I set-up large conferences, places that people go to learn and share ideas on specific topics.  It is engaging, rewarding, and fun.

lenders.name: Curt
lenders.loan_because: I believe in the concept of micro-credit. This is a terrific and easy way to help out people who are in need. Thanks, Kiva, for making this possible!
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a hospital near Seattle, USA. I'm an artist, writer, photographer, videographer and graphic designer.

lenders.name: Victor & Sara
lenders.loan_because: We believe in the entrepreneurial spirit, and are encouraged to see these individuals making an effort to provide a better life for themselves, their families, and their communities.  Our hat's off to all of them!
lenders.occupational_info:
Victor:  Works with IT Project Managers to make sure that new hardware and applications are implemented safely and securely.
Sara:  Writes procedures for Contact Center reps to follow to address client questions and problems.

We work for the same bank.

lenders.name: Angela
lenders.loan_because: I know what it's like to be in need of money, and how much a really loan means.  I think it's great to be able to help someone else in such a little way!
lenders.occupational_info: I am a computer programmer for an insurance company where I analyze, develop, code, & test programs that maintaing the insurance auto system.

lenders.name: Subhash
lenders.loan_because: I want to help those who help themselves.

lenders.name: Luke Byrne
lenders.loan_because: I have set up and run my own web development business then got out of it in early 2006. I am about to embark on setting up another venture in the coming months. Cash flow is vital, so I lend.
lenders.occupational_info: Bit of this, bit of that, all in the online space.

lenders.name: angie
lenders.loan_because: 'Money is like manure; it's not worth a thing unless it's spread around encouraging young things to grow.'

lenders.name: Christy
lenders.loan_because: It feels like extending a hand across the world.
lenders.occupational_info: teacher

lenders.name: Bob
lenders.loan_because: I believe in the concept of a hand up rather than a handout.
lenders.occupational_info: Retired - hobbies: cars and computers/internet

lenders.name: Eileen
lenders.loan_because:
Sharing make us stronger.

C'est le partage qui fait la force.

lenders.name: Judy
lenders.loan_because: A little money from me can do a lot in another place.
lenders.occupational_info: I am retired and love to travel. This is a way to keep in touch with the world.

lenders.name: Natalia and Stefan
lenders.loan_because: We want to make a difference in someones life.  Hard work is always compensated and we want to see all these individuals succeed with their business. \"Today is for you and tomorrow it will me for me\".

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: Helping people establish themselves helps spawn a cycle of prosperity.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a mergers and acquisitions attorney. I help companies come together, change their structure and/or separate.

lenders.name: Nicole
lenders.loan_because: After travelling in South America, I want to help people reach their small business goals through organizations like Kiva. I help because I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I work at a small college in the library as the Image Specialist, which means I help people find and use images in their studies.

lenders.name: Albert
lenders.loan_because: Why not? Its a great concept and the right thing to do.

lenders.name: Ryan
lenders.loan_because: Nothing will change until we all take individual action.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for the govenment providing services to people in my community.

lenders.name: Peter
lenders.loan_because: I think our small loans can make a direct improvement to someone\'s life. This seems a responsible use of our fortunate status as first-world citizens. As Christians, we have a duty to be good stewards, and this can be one way to fill that duty.

lenders.name: Filip
lenders.loan_because: Everyone should have the right to pursue their own destiny.

lenders.name: James
lenders.loan_because: To share.

lenders.name: Ray
lenders.loan_because: I'm in a position to be able to help others achieve their hopes and dreams.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in a  Procurement and Subcontracts Management group for a world-wide engineering/construction company.

lenders.name: steve
lenders.loan_because: Jesus taught that Christians have a responsibility to help those in need-- those less fortunate than ourselves. Americans, even the poorest Americans, are very rich in comparison to the rest of the world. Providing financial handouts, while necessary in emergency situations, is a short term solution at best. Lending money to those who have the intention and ability to pay it back  is biblical and leaves the borrower with a sense of dignity all humans deserve.
lenders.occupational_info: My work is to lead as many people as possible to know Jesus Christ and how to receive an eternal life in heaven.

lenders.name: Helle H. Christensen
lenders.loan_because: It makes sence.

lenders.name: Michael
lenders.occupational_info: I teach people how to use computer software.

lenders.name: Jennifer
lenders.loan_because: Being a small part of a greater good and a great way for a global community to come together.

lenders.name: Thomas Huusom
lenders.occupational_info: Typing in an endless sequence of numbers, split by a coffee break now and then.

lenders.name: Lucas
lenders.loan_because: It seems like a good investment vehicle both morally and financially.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a photographer.  I take pictures of people, places and things and sell them to people who need or want them.

lenders.name: Heather
lenders.loan_because: It's great to help in a small way for others to achieve their objectives personnally and in business.
lenders.occupational_info: Family-run Coffee and Patisserie (cakes!) Shop owner in tourist town by the sea. I get to do the paperwork!

lenders.name: Helena
lenders.loan_because: Other women's stories touch me.  I want to help them and their families.

lenders.name: Linda
lenders.loan_because: I didn't even know about Kiva until my dear friend Joel gave me a gift of money to invest through Kiva. It's a meaningful gift that keeps on giving, and I intend to continue the giving for as long as I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I am an artist and designer (brochures, logos, posters, catalogs, annual reports, etc.), but also do web design work. I am most interested in working with clients involved in the visual and performing arts, publishing and small businesses and organizations that promote positive change in their communities.

lenders.name: Chris
lenders.loan_because: I can give and give and give.
lenders.occupational_info: I help children in the US learn to read and write.

lenders.name: Fabeku
lenders.loan_because: At the end of the day, we're all connected. And when one person finds goodness, we all find goodness.

lenders.name: Thomas
lenders.loan_because: Investment Purposes
lenders.occupational_info: Computer Consulting

lenders.name: Sean
lenders.loan_because: Charity is one thing - loans are another.

lenders.name: Dorothy
lenders.loan_because: it makes sense to me to help others to do the work they choose to do, by giving small loans. I have much, comparatively, and I believe the world will be better when we eliminate extremes of wealth and poverty. We are citizens of one world.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach human services to non-traditional students at a small private university in Alaska. My adult students are my teachers.

lenders.name: Cesar
lenders.loan_because: I have been truly blessed in this life, and I believe it is an honor & a duty to help others in need.

lenders.name: The Mosio Project
lenders.loan_because: We want to make a difference through The Mosio Project by helping small business owners in mobile services and transportation, two industries that connect people.
lenders.occupational_info: Mosio is a mobile software and solutions company specializing in text messaging solutions for clinical research. We enable researchers to recruit and retain study participants more effectively, bringing new therapies to people who need them, faster and less expensively.

lenders.name: Amber
lenders.loan_because: I feel this is a way to serve the global community, one individual at a time and in a very practical way.  As an entrepreneur myself (even living in a privileged economy - North America)... I know how difficult starting up a business can be.  I\'m so excited to be a small part of making that process a little easier for somebody else.
lenders.occupational_info: I take photographs, and make artwork for people.

lenders.name: Scott
lenders.loan_because: This is amazingly beatutiful. Any econ student should know this. It gives dignity, along with oportunity and the incentive for creativity.
lenders.occupational_info: If you have a job that is challenging in a country other than the US. I would like my job to be working for you.

lenders.name: Shelby
lenders.loan_because: I've lived in East Africa and seen the unbelievable effects of microfinance and Kiva with my own eyes. I like loaning because it's not giving someone a handout - just giving them a hand.
lenders.occupational_info: I help ensure that the hard earned dollars that are loaned through Kiva make it safely to the entrepreneurs across the world, and that the money is also reliably repaid to those lenders.

lenders.name: Sara
lenders.loan_because: This organization is so awesome because it allows me to know to whom my money is actually going and to be part of this person\\\'s vision for success.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a creative spiritual teacher. I lead workshops for women around the themes of writing, spirituality and the creative process that are unique, empowering and lots of fun! I also paint tons of Buddhas, angels, shamans and chickens.

lenders.name: Scott
lenders.loan_because: It makes a difference.

lenders.name: Derek
lenders.loan_because: It's the right thing to do.

lenders.name: Peace Lutheran

lenders.occupational_info: We are a Peace and Justice group that meets monthly to support efforts to reduce poverty, hunger and injustice, at home and around the world.

lenders.name: Brad Marshall

lenders.loan_because: I think everyone has a responsibility to help those in need.

lenders.loan_because: I am inspired by the hard working people who I lend to.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with kids who do not have a stable family.  We find adult volunteers in our community who can be a consistent and trusted friend and guide to these kids because they need caring adults in their lives just like any youth.

lenders.name: Goodfootin
lenders.loan_because: I am thrilled to provide an opportunity for someone who is working to improve their life, and all they need is a small loan from me.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach World History to 16 year old school kids.

lenders.name: Betsy-Women with tude
lenders.loan_because: It feels good.
lenders.occupational_info: I try to raise two boys to be good world citizens.

lenders.name: Joyce
lenders.loan_because: I'm a firm believer in the power of Karma!
lenders.occupational_info: I renovate homes for sale and for private clients.

lenders.occupational_info: I sell  presentation packaging accross the globe

lenders.loan_because: I can. I am a mother of five, and am grateful for the blessings in my life.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a teacher, for more than 20 years. I teach children with disabilities or learning problems. I love to see children smile.

lenders.name: Rashke
lenders.loan_because: Why not?

lenders.name: Ariel
lenders.loan_because: I was inspired by the story of Muhammad Yunus. I think microcredit is a brilliant concept and I love being able to take part.

lenders.name: Andrea
lenders.loan_because: I love being able to help people all across the globe, and I love that once one person has gotten their loan and repaid it, I can turn around and help someone else.

lenders.name: Cathy
lenders.loan_because: When I have needed help, God has always provided.  I do this out of love for God who has given to me, that others might be blessed too.

lenders.name: Millicent
lenders.loan_because:
I was born and raised in Kenya.
I have seen the suffering people go through.
I know how they struggle to put up  businesses and projects which enable them put food on the table and educate their children. 
If the small amount i loan will help alleviate poverty, then i am glad to help.

lenders.name: Sue
lenders.loan_because: We are one community, one family on this planet and we need to honor our connection through all the ways of love, compassion and respect.
lenders.occupational_info: I am the co-founder of Morning Star, a Center for Change.  We help to facilitate the growth of the human spirit through counseling, energy work, yoga, meditation, and teaching many classes on spirituality.

lenders.name: Jukka

lenders.loan_because: I want to see other people succeed. What goes around, comes around.

lenders.name: Wyatt
lenders.loan_because: i like people.
lenders.occupational_info: i entertain audiences in the theater.

lenders.name: Caroline
lenders.loan_because: I have long wanted to support people in creating opportunities that are scaled to their needs and desires - and Kiva makes that possible.
lenders.occupational_info: I support companies in determining the most effective ways to engage with the environment and sustainable development.

lenders.name: Daniel
lenders.loan_because: Being born in the USA I have been very blessed from birth.  I am disabled and do not have a lot but anyone can find something to give.  God's Blessings....
lenders.occupational_info:
I am disabled and can not work.
I am a House Husband / Father.

lenders.name: Larry
lenders.loan_because: It feels good to help other entrepreneurs establish business
lenders.occupational_info: I consult, train and develop entrepreneurs

lenders.name: James
lenders.loan_because: Everyone needs the chance to feel accomplishment..
lenders.occupational_info: Selling Technology Products

lenders.name: Elda
lenders.loan_because: I can. :)
lenders.occupational_info: I work for an organization that provides free lessons in art, music, dance and drama to 12,000 children, as part of their school day.

lenders.name: J.T. & Family
lenders.loan_because: We desire to be part of the Global Community.  Even if we can only play a small role the influence in somebody\'s life could be extraordinary.  The efforts of Kiva and their partners brings hope and there is no greater power in life than hope.
lenders.occupational_info: We respect hard work and selflessness, and embrace those who are willing to chase their dreams.  Good luck and God bless-

lenders.name: Jorgen & André
lenders.loan_because: I believe that the combination of microfinance and entrepeneurship will create an accelerated path out of poverty
lenders.occupational_info: I create, develop and raise funds for companies.

lenders.name: Renee
lenders.loan_because: I want to learn about businesses in other parts of the world, and do my part to help them succeed.
lenders.occupational_info: I review the accounting and business processes of companies to help them improve their way of doing business.

lenders.name: Cori & Charles
lenders.loan_because: These loans are made in honor of my Dad, who worked hard to raise our family. Microlending is an economic miracle, and one of the simplest ways I have seen to redistribute wealth and share resources, especially for women around the globe ( the backbones of the earth), who only need a little help to lift themselves up.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with people to help them repair their relationships with themselves, others and the world, thus bringing the shared dream of peace, justice and harmony on earth that much closer.

lenders.name: Mark B. Watson
lenders.loan_because: While Mark was on a peacekeeping mission in Africa he saw, first hand, the importance of allowing people to to gain independence through having their own business. Living in Canada affords us the opportunity to help others. Kiva is one such way.
lenders.occupational_info: Mark is an officer in the Canadian Navy.

lenders.name: Carter Zoe Char Dad
lenders.loan_because: I want peoples dreams to come true (Char 9 yrs old). I want to share our prosperity (Carter 12 yrs old). We are so lucky and I want to share the joy that comes from that.(Zoe 10 yrs old)

lenders.name: DaleLynn
lenders.loan_because: This is an incredibly easy, affordable and gratifying way to be a part of the solution.  There is really no reason NOT to do this.
lenders.occupational_info: Natural Resource Conservation

lenders.name: Duncan
lenders.loan_because: It's the right thing to do.
lenders.occupational_info: Serving Christ in any way I can.

lenders.name: Sarah
lenders.occupation: Owner of a Web Strategy business
lenders.loan_because: Sometimes people just need a small break to make great and good changes.  It's good to pay it forward too...
lenders.occupational_info: I make it easy for the web-wary to have a website and integrate it into their business so that it brings them added value rather than becoming a burden!

lenders.name: Goff Family
lenders.loan_because: It's the right thing to do. Because we can.

lenders.name: JJG
lenders.loan_because: i can.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a company that develops and implements ways to clean up polluted groundwater.

lenders.name: Holiday Investments
lenders.loan_because: Our family makes donations every year during the holidays and we thought this was a great idea for us in 2007 anad 2008.
lenders.occupational_info: All of our family works in Washington, DC: a builder, a teacher, several work for consulting companies, a social worker, and one works for the International Monetary Fund.

lenders.name: Nicholas
lenders.loan_because: it's a small step closer to an equal opportunity world.

lenders.name: Shannon
lenders.loan_because: I am fortunate enough to live in America where opportunity is around every corner.. It's important to give back where you can!

lenders.name: Doug and Walker Silsbee
lenders.loan_because: This provides us a chance to share our good fortune with others across the world, and to be more connected with our brothers and sisters in other countries.
lenders.occupational_info: Walker manages a retreat center, where people gather to learn, to celebrate, to be married. Doug helps teach people in business to be more effective in what they do. His website is http://dougsilsbee.com.

lenders.name: Aaron
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a software and social entrepreneur. I start, or help to start, companies that develop software and I help develop community outreach programs and organizations as side projects. My community outreach work has mostly consisted of educational programs for under-served predominately minority communities in the United States.

lenders.name: Evelyn
lenders.loan_because: I wish to "pay it forward."
lenders.occupational_info: artist, online activist

lenders.name: Cory
lenders.loan_because: My father is an entrepreneur, I am an entrepreneur and I want to help give others the great feeling of successfully running a business and we all know cashflow is crucial starting up.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with computers. Designing websites, usability, administration, testing.

lenders.name: Rob Castaneda
lenders.loan_because: I have been blessed with a beautiful family and have not had to live through war and/or hardship

lenders.name: Kevin
lenders.loan_because: it's the right thing to do
lenders.occupational_info: Design radar systems to collect data over Greenland and Antarctic ice sheets so scientists can create better models in predicting future sea level rise

lenders.name: BHS Piller Advisory
lenders.loan_because: We loan because we would like to invest in small businesses and would like to see them grow. We also like to help others in our global community as we would like help ourselves. We understand the importance of our connection to other communities world wide.
lenders.occupational_info: We are students in the 11th grade in Beaverton, Oregon USA

lenders.name: Jennifer & Terry
lenders.loan_because: It is important for anyone to have access to capital to start their own business and be self sufficient.
lenders.occupational_info: Jennifer is a Send Out Cards distributor. Terry is an employee of a large wireless mobility company.

lenders.name: Maria
lenders.loan_because: its my responsibility and it grounds me not to complain about things like someone cutting me off or an officemate that irritates me.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a social studies teacher in a Social Justice Learning Academy

lenders.name: Rhodes College Class
lenders.loan_because: We are university students studying international development.  We hope to learn more about micro-credit's potential for helping people in developing countries.

lenders.name: CDC
lenders.loan_because: I haven\'t loaned yet - I\'ve just registered. I\'m looking forward to helping out !
lenders.occupational_info: I used to do a lot of comminity based work in past jobs but things changed and now my job requires sitting behind a desk all day !  \r\n\r\nI found the site very interesting and like the idea of being able to support community work half way around the world !

lenders.name: Bridgit Jacobsen
lenders.loan_because: Everyone needs help sometimes.
lenders.occupational_info: I sing and dance with little children!

lenders.name: BW Consulting
lenders.loan_because: We have a duty to help the world in any and every way we can.  Entrepreneurs are the backbone of self-sustaining communities and giving them loans is a great way to start a ripple effect.
lenders.occupational_info: Brighter World Consulting LLC helps entrepreneurs become more successful using strategy consulting.  We are results-oriented and charge only a percentage of the revenue we generate for our clients. We also ask  our clients to donate a percentage of the profits we generate and we match this donation.

lenders.name: benjamin
lenders.loan_because: \"Every single individual on earth has both the potential and the right to live a decent life. Across cultures and civilizations, Yunus and Grameen Bank have shown that even the poorest of the poor can work to bring about their own development.\"  -2006 Nobel Peace Prize press release for Grameen Bank and its founder Muhammed Yunus for their work in microcredit.

lenders.name: Molly
lenders.loan_because: I have never seen a program that you can give so little and make such a big difference. I have often wished I could give friends/family/someone money for their business but in the US that means a lot more than I have to freely give. It\'s exciting.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a self-employed accountant.  My focus has always been on small(under 10 employees) creative businesses. I help these businesses create a system for keeping track of their sales and their expenses.  I teach them about taxes and how/when to pay them or I do it for them but I always teach them about this because I think it\'s important.  I always teach my clients about what I do because they are often unsure about math/bookkeeping/taxes. I require they always learn how read four reports: A/P, A/R, Profit & Loss and Balance Sheet, even if they never do any of the accounting.  I believe this is important to their entreprenurial self-esteem.

lenders.name: Miller Family
lenders.loan_because: Our family has a tradition each year at Christmas to place an empty box under the Christmas tree (called the \"Jesus box.\")  We each put money into the box, and after Christmas we discuss as a family where we\'d like to donate the money.  This year we decided to loan our money through Kiva.  We love the idea of connecting with individuals thousands of miles away and helping them prosper.
lenders.occupational_info: The parents of the family are both teachers.  The second generation and their spouses include an engineer, a writer, a pastor, a music therapist, a medical student, a university professor, an industrial designer, and a nursing student.  There are currently four members of the third generation, with  more expected to follow.

lenders.name: Stephanie
lenders.loan_because: It's a hand up not a hand out. Kiva offers a unique opportunity for me to see exactly where my money is going. I enjoy selecting specific projects and helping industrious people make their dreams come true. It's a chance to build vibrant, sustainable economies that goes far beyond charity.

lenders.name: Rob Mowery
lenders.loan_because: I believe in the aspect of the world economy and that everyone can get what they really want out of life, by helping enough other people get want they want out of life.
lenders.occupational_info: Trying to make the world a little better for everyone.

lenders.name: Dale, Jen, Zac & Skylar
lenders.occupation: Dale - Sales, Jen - Nurse, Zac & Skylar - Students
lenders.loan_because: We loan because we realize the importance of giving back to a world that has given us so much.
lenders.occupational_info: Dale sits at a desk and works on a computer all day.  Jen is a nurse and provides medical care.

lenders.name: Micah
lenders.loan_because: It helps people improve their situations.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for Wells Fargo Bank, in the Electronic Deposit Center.

lenders.name: tom
lenders.loan_because: I want to encourage and help any man who needs support to go next step

lenders.name: Ryan
lenders.loan_because: I wanted to give my wife a birthday gift that was meaningful.  Instead of another material good, I wanted her to know that someone's livelihood was enhanced in her name.  In our family, we don't want to take for granted the gifts we have simply because we live in a place like Canada. Pure luck...

lenders.name: DEEPAK
lenders.loan_because: It gives me plesure that my extra bucks are fulling someones else dreams.
lenders.occupational_info: I\'m a consultant as well as contractor with high moral values in work as well as in personal life.

lenders.name: Mike D
lenders.loan_because: KIVA is an organization where it seems to me that a little contribution can make a big difference; and while it sounds like a cliché, I like the idea of a contribution that "helps people help themselves".
lenders.occupational_info: I am a media analyst in a department with a lot of programs intended to help the public. Often they are well-perceived, but occasionally they are not. My work helps the politicans understand what messages they need to change or correct.

lenders.name: Kas
lenders.loan_because: I'm trying to do my bit...

lenders.name: Sylvia & Ralph
lenders.loan_because: We make the world a better place a step at a time.
lenders.occupational_info: Selling and servicing parts for machines.

lenders.name: Remi
lenders.loan_because: I feel in this way I can do my little bit to create understanding and compassion between the people in the world
lenders.occupational_info: I buy and sell shares in companies that are traded on stockexchanges

lenders.name: Traavis
lenders.loan_because: If I can improve the quality of even one person's life, then I have made a difference.

lenders.name: Hugh Cronwright
lenders.loan_because: Having spent a lot of time in the Pacific Islands, Africa and Asia, I know well how tough it can be to get a start. How hard people battle to progress. This Kiva Scheme is a small but great step for those who can get the chance to use it.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in the area of International Trade. This has been my main career path. Exporting and importing products. Have also served as Executive member of the Export Institute of New Zealand, and Convenor of Judges for the Export Awards.

lenders.name: Jeff
lenders.loan_because: I want to help and I can.  I appreciate the ability to connect to people around the world.

lenders.name: Lucas and Grandad
lenders.loan_because: Its a great way to help people from third world countries to improve their living standards. On the selfish front, it feels good to help, and its a great way to teach my Grandson geography, how people from other countries live, finance and compassion.

lenders.name: Sandy
lenders.loan_because: it\'s a great way to share with others, and help impoverished people become self sufficient and stand on their own two feet; \"if you give a man a fish, you feed him for a day. but teach a man to fish, and you feed him for his life.\" thanks Kiva!
lenders.occupational_info: I'm 18, and just graduated from high school. I'm currently taking a "gap year", to travel and learn about the world before I go to college in August. I am very interested in the impact of education, and want to study to learn how to help people and make a difference in the world.

lenders.name: Kali
lenders.loan_because: there's nothing i own.

lenders.name: Tom and Bobbi
lenders.loan_because: Not Two is Peace
lenders.occupational_info: We operate an international training institute dedicated to the expansion of human awareness.

lenders.name: Cheryl & Tim
lenders.loan_because: I am humbled by the amazing stories of courage and sacrifice I find here and am honored to have the opportunity to make a difference in someone\'s life.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a manager for a company that provided security hardware to the commercial market.

lenders.name: Jan
lenders.loan_because: My wife and I love the idea of micro-loans and have been looking to get into this for quite a number of years. We believe in people in general, and especially believe in people in developing countries who have a lot more drive than those in the so-called developed countries. For very little money (from our point of view), we can then make a huge difference to someone else.
lenders.occupational_info: I write computer programs that help the underlying infrastructure of the internet. My wife is a nurse, massage therapist, and a mother (the hardest job of the three).

lenders.name: Alex
lenders.loan_because: I have been blessed over the years with good fortune.  Others have helped me along the way, an d I only trying to do the same.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a marketing and small business consultant.

lenders.name: Pheng
lenders.loan_because: Believe in the value and role micro financing plays in a developing economy.

lenders.name: Todd and Judith
lenders.loan_because: This could really make a difference in someone's life.

lenders.name: Kriss
lenders.occupation: Executive Director - Center for Social Innovation

lenders.name: Stephen Mucher
lenders.loan_because: the possibilities exist.....
lenders.occupational_info: I teach and write about the past with a hope that my efforts might modestly inform how we can all live together

lenders.name: Justilien Gaspard
lenders.loan_because: to help people improve their lives and communities. Hope is the greatest gift anyone can give.

lenders.name: Keri
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a difference in the world. By American standards I\'m on the \"poor\" side, but I know how rich I am. I have a roof over my head, food on my table, and, best of all, a wonderful family. I am happy living a simple life and giving everything I can to causes that are making a difference. Kiva is the best idea to come along in a looong while. I support Kiva because it works! Yay Kiva!
lenders.occupational_info: I am mostly an artist-in-residence in schools, treatment facilities, etc. I teach Shakespeare, and I do drama therapy with at-risk kids. In my spare time I collect boxes of goods to send to orphanages in Russia (and now Africa) and try to stay informed about issues important to me: eliminating poverty, promoting adoption, supporting human rights across the world.

lenders.name: Richard & Mirella
lenders.occupation: Web Designer & Nurse for Sick Kids Hospital

lenders.name: Brad
lenders.loan_because: it seems like a great way to give people a boost toward running self-sustaining businesses in places that need them.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for a company that does research on energy and electricity technologies and business issues.

lenders.name: Jenna
lenders.loan_because: I would like the people to be successful in their lives.

lenders.name: Sabathine
lenders.loan_because: I have money I can live without in order to help someone else earn a living.

lenders.name: NoVES
lenders.occupation: Humanistic Religious Community just outside D.C.
lenders.loan_because: We have faith in the ability of humans to make this a more perfect world.  We teach our children that deed comes before creed.  The Northern Virginia Ethical Society (NoVES) will raise money for our Kiva Basket, and once we get the project organized, the the youth of our Society will manage our portfolio and report periodically to the Society.  We hope that the lessons that our youth will learn from this will stand them in good stead for the rest of their lives as their dedication to this activity will benefit others in the world.
lenders.occupational_info: Our prime directive is to act so as to bring out the best in others.  By so doing we hope to bring out the best in ourselves.  We engage our children in a variety of service activities to our community.  In that regard, we can extend their experiences of serving to a worldwide community.

lenders.name: JoAnn & Jon
lenders.loan_because: We care.

lenders.name: Scott
lenders.loan_because: I have been in this position myself.  .....Just needing a little help to make a dream come true.  These entrepreneurs are the people who make the world work for the benefit of us all.  Helping people help themselves;  there is no better partnership.

lenders.name: Jeff
lenders.loan_because: I see Kiva as a way to truly change the world.  One entrepreneur at a time.

lenders.name: Don, Lori & Claire
lenders.loan_because: Everybody deserves a chance.

lenders.name: Filippo Angelini
lenders.occupational_info: mechanic

lenders.name: Nima
lenders.loan_because: I believe in the power of business and capital to affect poverty.

lenders.name: Thomas Vinther
lenders.loan_because: Microloans are very efficient for improving the quality of life in the receiving communities.
lenders.occupational_info: Database adminstration of a municipal pipegrid.

lenders.name: Katja
lenders.loan_because: This is a great opportunity to help people to help themselves.

lenders.name: amanda
lenders.loan_because: I want others to have some sense of the same financial security I have recently acheived.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach art appreciation, art history, and art making to children ages 5-12.  I also make small crafts and sell them at markets.

lenders.name: Julie
lenders.loan_because: I feel like I can make a very tangible difference here (I also volunteer as an editor). Sometimes I miss that feeling in other parts of my life.

lenders.name: Dieter
lenders.loan_because: I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I create websites for small businesses and non-profits.

lenders.name: Leigh
lenders.loan_because: People have certainly helped me out in the past - I want to pass it on, even if I can never be a big financier!
lenders.occupational_info: I am first and foremost a single mother of a wonderful eight year-old boy. I also go to work every day, assisting other; In between I read and try to have fun. My life hasn't been easy, but I'm still here!!!

lenders.name: Jeffery Gunter
lenders.occupation: IT Mgmt - CIO for Financial Institution
lenders.loan_because: I believe that God has given me and my family so much that we should share in His blessings.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in a small community bank.  Technology changes very fast today and my job is to keep the bank up to date with the latest software, hardware and security implementations to keep our records and accounts safe and keep the bad guys out!

lenders.name: Elise
lenders.loan_because: To be able to connect and hopefully improve the lives of people around the world. The large systems that we have now do not help people out of poverty it keeps them in it and I  appreciate the opportunity to be part of the solutions.

lenders.name: Jonathan
lenders.loan_because: I love the personal nature of my help. In the past, I have written about microfinance programs for another international nonprofit and I know how much more can be achieved with the same money when it is loaned and repaid as opposed to simple grants.
lenders.occupational_info: I help nonprofit organizations plan their strategies and tell their stories.

lenders.name: Veronica
lenders.loan_because: I can. This is a very simple way to make a difference and I am happy that I am in a position to make a change.
lenders.occupational_info: I sell branding design services to big corporations. When a new product is developed, my agency develop strategies on how to best market that new product as well as designs the packaging for various categories such as food and health & beauty. I am the person who find our clients.

lenders.name: William
lenders.loan_because: It is fun to help others to help themselves. Over the years we had many loans for inventory and improvements... everybody can use some help.
lenders.occupational_info: Retired... 100% free time. Reading, relaxing, having fun.

lenders.name: Marjorie
lenders.loan_because: I believe in the transformative power of small actions that can make a large difference in people\'s lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I manage the collection of painting and sculpture in a medium-size art museum.

lenders.name: Scott & Peg Armstrong
lenders.loan_because: we're fortunate enough to be able to.
lenders.occupational_info: We both work in theatre. Scott works as a freelance Audio Engineer and Peg is a general manager for a well known arts in education program.

lenders.name: Fred
lenders.loan_because: I can

lenders.name: Rick and Katy
lenders.loan_because: It is the "next right thing" to do
lenders.occupational_info: I help people find travel deals at prices they can afford.

lenders.name: JESSE
lenders.loan_because: "i get by with a little help from my friends"
lenders.occupational_info: an office drone

lenders.name: Beverly
lenders.loan_because: it is a great way to help others be more self-sufficient.

lenders.name: Isabelle
lenders.loan_because: everyone should have access to affordable financial services.
lenders.occupational_info: I lead The Smart Campaign, a global initiative to keep clients first in microfinance by imbedding core Principles of Client Protection into all aspects of microfinance operations.  The Smart Campaign is housed at the Center for Financial Inclusion at ACCION International.

lenders.name: Nicky
lenders.loan_because: The spirit of the universe moves me, but also the spirit of my friend Tracey. In 2006, first her brother Robyn and then her father were diagnosed with cancer and both have sinced passed away. Tracey is studying economics and environmental geography and intends to work in the non-profit development field when she completes her degree. Her father began life as a farm boy in India before moving to Canada and so in honour of all that her family has gone through this past year, I make my first KIVA loan.
lenders.occupational_info: I work at city hall in the office that processes development applications. How much better it is to assist development overseas.

lenders.name: Bryan and Cheryl
lenders.occupation: church A/V tech and social worker
lenders.loan_because: I want to reduce the income discrepancy that exists in the world and help more people become economically self-reliant.
lenders.occupational_info: I (Bryan) work at my church and make sure that all of the video, lighting, projection, and sound equipment is working properly and that the personnel using this equipment is well-supported, and my wife (Cheryl) helps teenagers transition from living on the streets to being able to live in an apartment (or better) and to make healthy life choices.

lenders.name: Ryan
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.loan_because: Makes me feel good,and it is easy to do.
lenders.occupational_info: Long irregular hours,with great scenery.

lenders.name: Iowa Dave

lenders.name: Erica & Alex
lenders.loan_because: It's awesome and it makes an impact...besides, we have more than enough...it's good to share.

lenders.loan_because: all are one...

lenders.name: Hannah and Eric
lenders.loan_because: we want to help them.  We use part of our allowance for donations.

Our family seems a lot happier taking materialism out of the holidays.  I am now earning a little myself and will add to the original amount  as my business income allows.

lenders.name: Cathy

lenders.name: Keith & Parker

lenders.name: Linda

lenders.occupational_info: I volunteer with Habitat for Humanity London. Previously I worked in Telecom in Canada.

lenders.name: Anna

lenders.occupational_info: Bueno, mi megocio, consta de promocionar en internet, a travez de una pagina de mi pais, articulos como accesorios de celulares, fundas, carcasas,baterias. las personas me contactan x internet y las entregas las hago a domicilio

lenders.name: Audrey
lenders.loan_because: Life can be unfair, so I believe in correcting the imbalances in whatever way I can.

lenders.occupational_info: I go to school full time and work at a law firm part-time. I\'m studying international law and hope to be able to travel to some of these loan countries one day.

lenders.loan_because: I only have a small amount in the bank, but some people need it more than I do.

lenders.name: Charles

I am retired living in Guanajuato, Mexico. I am probably not in physical condition to help build houses or the like, but with Kiva I can help others.

lenders.name: Terry
lenders.loan_because: A great way to help people.

lenders.name: Steven

lenders.name: defenestrated

Also, as someone with limited funds available, it's great to be able to keep some money continuously at work through Kiva even when I'm not able to give to humanitarian causes on an ongoing basis.

lenders.name: matt
lenders.loan_because: the borrowers seem like good people and I think it is great for people to own their own businesses.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a firefighter

lenders.name: Deirdre
lenders.occupational_info: taking care of elderly patients in the hospital

lenders.name: Lisa & Ronny
lenders.loan_because: a good friend who is celebrating his 40th birthday introduced us to Kiva.  In honour of this friend\'s birthday, a group of us are attempting to make enough loans to positively affect the lives of 40 different low-income entrepreneurs around the world.

lenders.name: Talmadge & Sharon
lenders.loan_because: We believe that capitalism and entrepreneurship combined with hard work, smart work, perseverance (and an occasional unexpected blessing) can raise a person from poverty to any level of economic prosperity that he or she can conceive.

lenders.name: Birgit
lenders.loan_because: I realise we are very fortunate in Western Europe, most people here have plenty of opportunities. It makes me feel good to share my wealth and to help other people with it especially because the people asking for loans on Kiva don't expect a free ride but earn it.

lenders.name: Allison & Tim
lenders.loan_because: We want to make a contribution to the world for those who could use our support to do good things in their countries.
lenders.occupational_info: We are students in university.  Allison studies Human Development and Tim studies University Administration.

lenders.name: Alison & Alistair
lenders.loan_because: Have first hand experience with people's ingenuity and entrepreneurialism in different parts of the world.  We want to contribute to good ideas that help real people on the ground.
lenders.occupational_info: Alison researches environmental and social justice issues and teaches at the University.  Alistair writes movies, documentaries, and TV shows.

lenders.name: Austin
lenders.loan_because: I Want to help people with no money and that need help with their families and their stores
lenders.occupational_info: 7th grade student at Keller Middle School

lenders.name: Mark
lenders.loan_because: It's a direct method with which to truly help another person, family, or group. The power of many moves mountains.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a husband and dad.

lenders.name: Zvi
lenders.loan_because: When its paid back, I know it went to something productive and useful.

lenders.name: Alex & Caroline
lenders.loan_because: I think this is a good cause.

lenders.name: Frank
lenders.loan_because: Giving people the capital they need to start or expand their business at no interest can really change their lives.

lenders.name: Caroline
lenders.loan_because: ...it's effortless and I've been given opportunities I wasn't born with so I want to give back.

lenders.name: Justin
lenders.loan_because: I believe that small amounts of capital in the right hands can change the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I study international business and negotiate the contractual agreement between my company and our customers (for aerospace products).

lenders.name: Avi & Rivka
lenders.loan_because: I want to help those born into a less fortunate financial situation than my own and with fewer opportunities for bettering their situation

lenders.name: wean
lenders.occupational_info:
Organization Profile of WEAN
Background 
Women Entrepreneurs Association of Nepal (WEAN) is a non-profit and a non-governmental organization. Despite the hardship of women in general in Nepal, in the year 1987 a few women entrepreneurs with the desire to organize women entrepreneurs under a single roof came together and formed the Women Entrepreneurs Association of Nepal (WEAN). Over the years WEAN has been seeking to develop new women entrepreneurs meanwhile trying to upgrade the capacity of existing women entrepreneurs. 
WEAN offers training, marketing assistance, and access to credit, networking and other extension services to urban and rural women entrepreneurs. Marketing assistance is provided by WEAN indirectly to its members through WEAN Co-operative, as sister organization which WEAN helped establish in 1991, as a marketing outlet for women entrepreneurs.          
Women Entrepreneurs Association of Nepal (WEAN), has over the years been actively involved in the betterment of women in Nepal. With the focus on the entrepreneurship growth for the women in the country, WEAN, for over the years has successfully conducted various trainings, programs and projects focusing primarily on the potential women entrepreneurs who could contribute economically in their locales and the surrounding areas. Recently with the political changes in the society and the growth of violence against women, WEAN has seen the need to address the plight of the conflict affected women who lost their family members and providers to conflict. WEAN feels it is the right time to shift its attention to these people so that the entrepreneurship skills could be developed and instilled on them. This will be a huge benefit to the society economically and also gives these people a chance to provide for themselves as well as their children without depending on others or the state. WEAN will also incorporate a new strategy to train these women in various occupations which traditional have been assigned to the male population of Nepal. By doing this WEAN will try to remove the stigma attached with the gender biased occupations. 
Objectives of WEAN  
Increase economic opportunities and create awareness among women entrepreneurs. 
Enhance business skills of potential and existing women entrepreneurs. 
Develop and upgrade skill of women entrepreneurs according to market needs. 
Advocate the role of women entrepreneurs in the new millennium 

WEAN Saving and Credit Program
Considering the fact that although rural woman had developed new skills and a greater sense of self-esteem and confidence as entrepreneurs after completion of training courses, most of them continued to face lack of access to capital. Therefore, in February 1995, WEAN, using its own allocated capital fund, launched a “Rural Savings and Credit Mobilization Program” to promote and develop micro enterprises run by rural women in Kathmandu valley and Syabrubesi in Rasuwa district. This program adopts a modified Grameen Banking model. Credit is being utilized for a variety of income generating activities, such as vegetable farming, poultry, tourism related services, production of bamboo crafts, handloom textiles, silk tie-dye products, and cloth cut work, incense and handmade paper products. 
In 1996, WEAN obtained funds in amount of NRs.1,68,000.00 from the Embassy of Australia based in Kathmandu to use as loan money for growing demand of groups in Syabru Bensi area. Micro Credit Program is most extensive and has been highly effective in Rasuwa district as no other NGO’s has been able to access to the poor women living in the remote mountainous region. 
In 1997, the credit program expanded further as WEAN was assigned to work with micro Credit Project for Women (MCPW), which is a joint program of HMG’s Women Development Division and CECI, a Canadian Project. Micro Credit Program of WEAN was running successfully under the MCPW project at Bungamati, Bagdole, Chunnikhel and Lagankhel areas of Lalitpur District. The total loan disbursement was NRs.24,87,500.00 obtained from ADB.
